intro: Lewisia aurantiaca, commonly known as the orange-leaved lewisia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant orange to red foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, preferring well-drained conditions and full sun. It is known for its ability to thrive in arid environments, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping. The flowers bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
